message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

Reasoning: The paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as writing normalization, lemmatization, and canonical segmentation, which are all subfields of NLP. The paper proposes a neural encoder-decoder solution for these tasks, which falls under the category of machine learning and deep learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also mentions the use of language models and part-of-speech information, which are related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of heterogeneous sources such as dictionaries, which could fall under the category of neural networks (cs.NE) or machine learning (cs.LG).
